TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract AnswerWizard implements class Microsoft.Office.Core._IMsoDispObj

summary.span: 代表应答向导中的 Microsoft Office 应用程序。

span.span: Represents the Answer Wizard in a Microsoft Office application.

remarks.span:
某些本主题中的内容不可能适用于某些语言版本。
没有每个应用程序，只有一个应答向导和AnswerWizard对象的所有更改或集合影响活动的 Office 应用程序立即。使用
方法，以从列表中删除所有项文件可用于当前应答向导。使用此方法可确保供 Office 主机应用程序的默认文件不再是可通过应答向导，如时您替换自定义访问。AW 文件。使用
方法，以还原到默认列表的文件的 Office 主机应用程序当前应答向导的文件列表。您还可以通过将自定义文件的名称添加到相应的注册表项; 建立在 Windows 注册表中的自定义的默认文件列表只有在应答然后还原该注册表项中指定的文件。使用
属性获取应答向导文件引用的集合。Files属性返回的字符串引用的集合。AW 文件。

span.para: Some of the content in this topic may not be applicable to some languages.
There is only one Answer Wizard per application, and all changes to the AnswerWizard object or the collection affect the active Office application immediately.

Use the method to remove all entries from the list of files available to the current Answer Wizard. Using this method ensures that the default files available to the Office host application are no longer accessible through the Answer Wizard, such as when you’re replacing the Answer Wizard files with custom .AW files.

Use the method to restore the list of files for the current Answer Wizard to the default list of files for the Office host application. You can also establish a custom default file list in the Windows registry by adding the names of the custom files to the appropriate registry key; the files specified in that registry key will then be restored when ResetFileList is called.
Use the property to get the collection of Answer Wizard file references. The Files property returns a collection of strings that refer to .AW files.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Application { System::Object ^ get(); };

summary.span: 返回一个Application对象，代表容器应用程序的对象。

span.span: Returns an Application object that represents the container application for the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearFileList() runtime managed

summary.span: 清除当前 AnswerWizard，包括 Microsoft Office 主机应用程序的文件的默认列表的文件的列表。

span.span: Clears the list of files for the current AnswerWizard, including the default list of files for the Microsoft Office host application.

span.para: 此方法用于删除指定应用程序当前文件列表中的所有条目。您可以使用它，以确保主机应用程序的默认 AnswerWizard 文件无对用户可用。然后可以通过使用生成的文件的自定义列表方法集合。
要还原为主机应用程序设置的默认 AnswerWizard 文件，请使用方法。

Use this method to remove all entries from the current file list for the specified application. You can also use it to ensure that none of the default AnswerWizard files for the host application are available to users. You can then build a custom list of files by using the method of the collection.
To restore the default AnswerWizard file set for the host application, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

summary.span: 返回一个 32 位整数，它指示在其中创建指定的对象的应用程序。

span.span: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.span:
此属性的工作方式的示例，它会返回 1297307460，如果在 Microsoft Word 中; 创建该对象代表字符串"MSWD"如果在 Microsoft Excel 中创建对象，此属性返回 1480803660。也可以通过在 Word 中，常量wdCreatorCode或 Excel 中的xlCreatorCode表示此值。主要设计
Creator属性用于 Macintosh，其中每个应用程序具有四个字符的创建者代码。例如，Microsoft Word 具有 MSWD 的创建者代码。有关此属性的其他信息，请咨询的语言参考 Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition 中包含的帮助。
Creator属性始终返回活动应用程序的数字标识符，就像Application属性将始终返回字符串形式的活动应用程序的名称。使用CreatedBy属性， ， ，和对象返回的人员创建这些对象的名称。使用文档属性可返回 Office 文档的作者信息。

span.para: As an example of how this property works, it returns 1297307460, which represents the string "MSWD", if the object was created in Microsoft Word; this property returns 1480803660 if the object was created in Microsoft Excel. This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode in Word, or xlCreatorCode in Excel.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

The Creator property always returns the numeric identifier for the active application, just as the Application property always returns the name of the active application in string form. Use the CreatedBy property of the , , , and objects to return the name of the individual who created those objects. Use document properties to return information about the authors of Office documents.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Files As AnswerWizardFiles

summary.span: 返回表示当前 AnswerWizard 文件可用列表集合。

span.span: Returns an collection that represents the list of files available to the current AnswerWizard.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

summary.span: 返回指定对象的父对象。

span.span: Returns the Parent object for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ResetFileList() runtime managed

summary.span: 重置当前 AnswerWizard 到 Microsoft Office 主机应用程序的文件的默认列表的文件的列表。

span.span: Resets the list of files for the current AnswerWizard to the default list of files for the Microsoft Office host application.

span.para: 使用此方法，以还原到宿主应用程序在 Windows 注册表中的列表的当前 AnswerWizard 文件列表中的所有条目。您可以通过将自定义文件的名称添加到相应的注册表项来建立注册表中的自定义的默认文件列表。
警告错误地编辑注册表可能会严重损坏操作系统，需要重新安装它。Microsoft 无法保证可以解析错误地编辑注册表导致的问题。编辑注册表之前, 备份任何有价值的数据。有关使用和保护您的计算机的注册表中的最新信息，请参阅 Microsoft Windows 帮助。

Use this method to restore all entries in the current AnswerWizard file list to the list in the Windows registry for the host application. You can establish a custom default file list in the registry by adding the names of the custom files to the appropriate registry key.

Caution Incorrectly editing the registry may severely damage your operating system, requiring you to reinstall it. Microsoft cannot guarantee that problems resulting from editing the registry incorrectly can be resolved. Before editing the registry, back up any valuable data. For the most recent information about using and protecting your computer's registry, see Microsoft Windows Help.
